alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 6:34AM AKST until January 14 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT FOR THIS WEEKEND... .Snow will continue to fall over the northern panhandle throughout the day today. Snow has begun transitioning to be wetter and more dense with snow ratios falling to 20 to one in the northern inner channels and will likely continue to moisten throughout the day. Snowfall rates are expected to gradually increase in intensity through the afternoon and into tonight. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait. * WHEN...Until 4 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to start mixing with rain Sunday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
